posts.post_content: Even costed at 5 it would be too weak. Modular really needed more efficient creatures. [Arcbound worker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcbound worker) was about right, as was [arcbound overseer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=arcbound overseer), but everything inbetween was pretty poor except the ridiculous Ravager.
posts.html:

Posted By: djflo (2/3/2011 7:02:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The problem with sunburst is that it means everything must cost 5 to get maximum efficiency. {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}{1} for a 5/5 modular just isn't worth it. You could get [Fusion Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fusion Elemental), [Maelstrom Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Archangel), or any of a number of other powerful WUBRGs for less.   
  
Edit: @Kryptnyt: True, but I would still rather have a Maelstrom Archangel at WUBRG than a 7/7 Frogmite at 1WUBRG.
posts.html:
The problem with sunburst is that it means everything must cost 5 to get maximum efficiency. {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}{1} for a 5/5 modular just isn't worth it. You could get Fusion Elemental, Maelstrom Archangel, or any of a number of other powerful WUBRGs for less.

Edit: @Kryptnyt: True, but I would still rather have a Maelstrom Archangel at WUBRG than a 7/7 Frogmite at 1WUBRG.

Posted By: MasterOfEtherium (12/19/2010 5:27:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@scissorslizard  
The powerful aspect of Modular is that you can stack them when they die. When Maelstrom Archangel dies you are left with nothing. When this dies you have a 7/7 frogmite.  
EDIT: You mean, you'd rather have an angel in the graveyard than a giant frogmite on the table, beating face.  
I'll admit though, if you build your deck to abuse the angel, she can be really strong. Fusion Elemental can't say the same, but I'll say that [Arcbound wanderer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcbound wanderer) CAN say the same.
posts.html:
@scissorslizard
The powerful aspect of Modular is that you can stack them when they die. When Maelstrom Archangel dies you are left with nothing. When this dies you have a 7/7 frogmite.
EDIT: You mean, you'd rather have an angel in the graveyard than a giant frogmite on the table, beating face.
I'll admit though, if you build your deck to abuse the angel, she can be really strong. Fusion Elemental can't say the same, but I'll say that Arcbound wanderer CAN say the same.

posts.post_content: I hope one day Wizards prints more Modular creatures. Sure, we missed out in Scars of Mirrodin, but there's always a chance a Mirrodin 3 / New Phyrexia 2 set or a Planechase product could bring them back. There are only 12 modular creatures, and this guy is unfortunately one of them.
